2.25.19  11:20 am   is there a chance that you would put any of your older music like "i can play" or "all u need is love" on spotify or itunes?

      thank you!
2.25.19  10:49 am   CAn you make full version of "That's the way i like to live my life" song from hi, i'm steve video ?

2.25.19  9:21 am   i have short and rare bursts of creativity where i get tons of songwriting and recording done, but these don't last more than a few days at the most. i've been planning  out an album for months and i finally have every song written, but can never find the motivation for long enough to make the final recordings of these songs, because i think i've losing interestin the album itself. i want to stick with it because i know that the music is good and the concept will hopefully be well rev=cieved, but my mind has shifted to other types of music. i don't want to start something else because i'm afraid that if i just keep jumping to new things every time i lose interest i'll never get anything done. would you rather put out material that you're not entirely happy with or chase something perfect that may not necessarily be attainable?

2.25.19  6:18 am   I'm over 30 labor hours into animating this comedic bit. I'm finally reaching the punch line and I don't know how to draw it funny, because it doesn't even sound funny to me anymore. Tips for this feel?
2.25.19  6:10 am   Does logic make any sense?

2.25.19  5:49 am   i like to create things on this machine but the problem is that the machine can instantly give me dopamine from the internet at any moment. i usually choose this option instead of creating something. how do i avoid this and use the machine to create more things

2.25.19  3:34 am   Around when in your career did the total duration every viewer spent viewing your work exceed the number of hours it took to create that same work?

      Do you consider that a valid threshold for success?

2.25.19  1:51 am   do you ever think of chords/voicings as a stack of intervals instead?

      Like, M3m3 would be a major chord expressed by a major third followed by a minor third. But in first inversion itd be m3P4, a minor third with a perfect fourth after it. Kind of what the idea is with roman numeral inversions, having I be root, I6 be first inversion (with implied third as middle voice, and the 6th being the top voice interval with bass note), and I64 for second inversion, (6th and 4th intervals from bass). Except this system ive been trying to figure out would show the relationship between each note to their closest note up and down. Ideally itd show all relationships, But I think intervals as a unit make sense trying to categorize chords not only by what notes are being played, but their inversions. Sometimes it feels like this way "harmony" or "notation" would make more sense. Best way I can think of it is a stack of geometry upwards like a totem, or stacked figures using the same center (with their corners touching the same imaginary circle).

Do you have a specific way you visualize/categorize relationships in music

      and how did you come upon it?

2.23.19  11:55 pm   Can we expect the return of reality videos? I absolutely love them. Please bring them back.

2.23.19  11:33 pm   Found this comment on the genius video, thought it was a decent analogy:
"Listening to Bill's music and then asking him what the lyrics mean is like taking a bite of food and then asking the chef how it tastes."
2.23.19  8:48 pm   how do you not lose motivation?

2.23.19  8:08 pm   I am so fucking lonely that even having friends family lovers acquaintances etc. doesn't help me anymore. That doesn't make any logical sense. That's like saying you're so hungry that eating food doesn't help anymore. Should I resign myself to the fact that my internal lonely-logic is broken and try to make a poem about it or some shit? I feel like a broken watering can put singlehandedly in charge of saving a rainforest that got teleported to the desert the moment I was born. or something fffffgdgdgdgdgkshgkshg Wait why am I typing this in a question box to the website of a total stranger, I should be writing this down. I don't feel like I make any more sense but thanks for having this text box where I can try. P.S. it's 8pm and I'm just now realizing I forgot to brush my teeth this morning because I was busy trying to figure out how to be okay with asonance instead of rhyming sometimes, why am I like this hhhhhhhhhh P.P.S. your latest video was fucking *fire emoji*
2.23.19  6:09 pm   Why don't you put some rad guitar solos in your songs?
2.23.19  5:03 pm   where did you get that helm you're wearing in "when i get older"

2.23.19  4:42 pm   i heard you say in an interview recently that prior to maybe 2014 or so you didn't have a schedule and nothing got done.

      I can identify with that in a way. I feel like I'm always wanting to write these grand opuses out of my ideas, treating them like they have boundless potential and that I should only see them through to their maximum potential while also wanting spend time getting better at my instruments, spend time listening to other people/learning, going to work etc. and i slowly chip away at everything but nothing gets done. I may have fear of letting go of the attachment to my ideas and wanting to make them so grand. Did you have any hard time transitioning from not having a schedule to having a schedule? Did you have to set yourself time limits or alarms to remember to do certain things and move on to the next? Has having the schedule made you not just more productive in general as a result of it, but gradually increased your capacity to be more productive over time of consistently adhering to it?
